manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Squished Allergic Invisible Parachute Kids More Great Graphix Reads From the powerhouse duo behind the instant bestseller Allergic comes a spirited new graphic novel about finding your own space… especially when you're in a family of nine! A coming-of-age middle-grade graphic novel featuring a girl with severe allergies who just wants to find the perfect pet! For fans of New Kid and Allergic, a must-have graphic novel about five very different students who are forced together by their school to complete community service... and may just have more in common than they thought. A funny, fast-paced, and heartrending story about three siblings living on their own as undocumented new immigrants.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for 9 to 10 yr olds
reviews.reviewText: The granddaughter loves these books. I love the facts she is enjoying her reading time. A win, win situation!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun, positive, smart memoir
reviews.reviewText: Fun, smart, nuanced take on social acceptance or lack thereof which has a positive attitude without sugar-coating. Worth reading for all ages. In particular it's nice to see a book that doesn't lean into the stereotype of cheerleaders as evil, nasty people that has become such a cliche nowadays.Meanwhile, note that the 1-star reviewers (as of the time I write this) are lying. Not only is there no anti-Christian hate in this book or anything that could honestly be construed as such, but the author speaks appreciatively of her experiences attending Christian church growing up. ... she also attended services at a Buddhist temple, however, and as a child positively compared the social messages of Jesus and the Buddha and wondered if it was really necessary to choose between them. So now you know where the 1-star reviewers are coming from ... I would encourage everyone to report false reviews, as they violate the terms of service.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars a charming story about embracing ourselves
reviews.reviewText: (Disclaimer: I received this book from the publisher. This has not impacted my review which is unbiased and honest.)The Tryout is a book that not only balances the racism that breaks my heart - especially for middle grade readers - but also the joy in embracing ourselves. In knowing where we come from, celebrating our home, and what makes us different. The Tryout examines this quintessential middle grade experience which I'm not sure we ever grow out of - the pressure to fit in. To try to fit ourselves in a mold of what people want can require a price. A way in which we betray ourselves, the ones we love, and more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It was amazing
reviews.reviewText: This was an unbelievable book it was so good I could read it Every day I sooooo recommend it I loved it so much the book shows that in life everything is not perfect it will never be how you want it to be I am only nine years old but I had to review it and with that being said ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My Daughter loves it
reviews.reviewText: My Daughter is 9 and she said she loved this book! She started reading the newer graphic novel baby sitters club books.. She finished the series.. so I was trying to find something similar

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2022
reviews.reviewText: The Tryout is a fantastic book that allows the author to share a unique experience that is different than the experiences many others have had. It is essential to try to understand the lives others have lead and how they are different from our own. The Tryout shares a real middle school experience. It’s the kind of book people should read to help broaden their views and understanding.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent middle-grade graphic novel!
reviews.reviewText: These are the books that we ALL need to expand our worlds and create empathy. I loved how this was based on the author's actual life experiences with real pictures at the end. I witness so much of this drama and anxiety and every day with my middle-school students. I'm definitely going to have to get multiple copies of this one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars DOES NOT GO WITH CHRISTIAN MORALS
reviews.reviewText: There are a few pages that are iffy because the girl1. goes to worship buddha at a temple2. feels that buddha and Jesus were buddies and freindsOther than that, i feel like it's really long which i like because most graphic novels are pretty short to me. I think that the pictures are pretty good and so i would recommend to you just be aware of the few pages that I meantioned above! : )
Perfect gift for a 9 year old girl. Has been read once already and is planned to be read again very soon
